freeports_analysis.formats_utils.pdf_filter.xml.position

PDF block element utilities for spatial analysis and manipulation.

This module provides functions for working with PDF block elements (represented as lxml.etree.Element objects) that contain bounding box information. It includes utilities for checking spatial relationships, extracting coordinates, and calculating dimensions of PDF content blocks.

Functions

get_bounds(blk)

Get the horizontal and vertical bounds of a block's bounding box.

get_lines_contained(blk[, x_range, y_range])

get_position(blk, mean)

Return the coordinates or center of a bounding box from a PDF block element. :param blk: XML element representing the PDF block, expected to contain a 'bbox' attribute. :type blk: etree.Element :param mean: If True, return the center point (x, y) of the bounding box. If False, return the full bounding box coordinates (x0, y0, x1, y1). :type mean: bool.

get_size(blk)

Calculate the width and height of a block's bounding box.

is_contained(blk[, x_range, y_range])

Check if a block's bounding box is fully contained within specified ranges.

is_positioned(blk[, x_range, y_range])

Check if a block is positioned within specified x and/or y ranges.
freeports_analysis.formats_utils.pdf_filter.xml.position.get_bounds(blk: Element) → list | None

Get the horizontal and vertical bounds of a block’s bounding box.

Parameters:

blk (etree.Element) – XML element representing a PDF block, expected to contain a ‘bbox’ attribute.

Returns:

A list containing two tuples representing horizontal (x0, x1) and vertical (y0, y1) bounds. Returns None if no ‘bbox’ attribute is found.

Return type:

list of tuple or None

freeports_analysis.formats_utils.pdf_filter.xml.position.get_position(blk: Element, mean: bool) → list | None

Return the coordinates or center of a bounding box from a PDF block element. :param blk: XML element representing the PDF block, expected to contain a ‘bbox’ attribute. :type blk: etree.Element :param mean: If True, return the center point (x, y) of the bounding box.

If False, return the full bounding box coordinates (x0, y0, x1, y1).

Returns:

A list of float values representing either the full bounding box or its center. Returns None if no ‘bbox’ attribute is found.

Return type:

list of float or None

freeports_analysis.formats_utils.pdf_filter.xml.position.get_size(blk: Element) → Tuple[float, float]

Calculate the width and height of a block’s bounding box.

Parameters:

blk (etree.Element) – XML element representing a PDF block with a ‘bbox’ attribute

Returns:

A tuple containing (width, height) of the bounding box

Return type:

Tuple[float, float]

freeports_analysis.formats_utils.pdf_filter.xml.position.is_contained(blk: Element, x_range: Tuple[float, float] | None = None, y_range: Tuple[float, float] | None = None) → bool

Check if a block’s bounding box is fully contained within specified ranges.

Parameters:

  • blk (etree.Element) – XML element representing a PDF block

  • x_range (Optional[Tuple[float, float]], optional) – Horizontal range (min_x, max_x)

  • y_range (Optional[Tuple[float, float]], optional) – Vertical range (min_y, max_y)

Returns:

True if entire bbox is within ranges, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

freeports_analysis.formats_utils.pdf_filter.xml.position.is_positioned(blk: Element, x_range: Tuple[float, float] | None = None, y_range: Tuple[float, float] | None = None) → bool

Check if a block is positioned within specified x and/or y ranges. :param blk: XML element representing a PDF block :type blk: etree.Element :param x_range: Minimum and maximum x-coordinate values (left, right) :type x_range: Optional[Tuple[float, float]], optional :param y_range: Minimum and maximum y-coordinate values (bottom, top) :type y_range: Optional[Tuple[float, float]], optional

Returns:

True if block’s coordinates are within specified ranges, False otherwise

Return type:

bool
